PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
 
1.  During  the  country  programming  mission  held  in  Manila  in  December  2012,  the 
Government of the People’s Republic of China (PRC) requested the Asian Development Bank 
(ADB)  to  assist  the  Shandong  Water  Resources  Department  (SWRD)  of  the  Shandong 
Provincial Government (SPG) to prepare the Shandong Groundwater Allocation and Protection, 
which is included in ADB’s lending program for 2015 (standby). A project preparatory technical 
assistance (PPTA) is provided to undertake due diligence in technical, safeguards, economic 
and financial, and poverty and social areas. The PPTA will help ensure compliance with ADB’s 
requirements and incorporation of international best practices in the project design. 
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
 
2.  The PPTA will carry out the following tasks related to the project: (i) assess the technical 
feasibility;  (ii)  conduct  due  diligence  on  the  economic  and  financial  feasibility;  (iii)  review 
safeguard  requirements;  (iv)  conduct  social  survey  and  consultations;  (v)  conduct  a 
procurement capacity assessment of the executing and implementing agencies and develop 
capacity  for  project  management;  (vi)  prepare  a  knowledge  product  and  policy  brief  on 
groundwater management, and (vii) prepare project documents, including ADB’s draft report 
and recommendation of the President and linked documents. The key outputs and activities are 
in Table A4.1.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
 
3.  The PPTA is estimated to cost $850,000 equivalent, of which ADB will finance $600,000 
on a grant basis from ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources) and 
$250,000 equivalent is requested from the Multi-Donor Trust Fund1 under the Water Financing 
Partnership  Facility  (WFPF),  which  will  be  administered  by  ADB.  The  SPG  will  provide 
counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff, remuneration, transport, data collection, 
logistic  support  in  arranging  workshops  and  field  visits,  fully  functional  office  space  for 
consultants with water and utility supplies, telephone line and access to internet, and other in-
kind contributions. The detailed cost estimates are presented in Table A4.2.

A.  Technical Assistance Special Fund-other (TASF-other sources)  
 
5.  For  the  TASF-other  sources  financed  consulting  services,  a  consulting  firm  will  be 
recruited using the quality- and cost-based selection method, using a quality–cost ratio of 80:20 
and simplified technical proposal according to ADB’s Guidelines on the Use of Consultants 
(2013, as amended from time to time). The outline terms of reference for the PPTA consultants 
are described below. 
 
6.  Water resources management specialist and team leader (international, 6 pm). The 
specialist  will  have  a  master’s  degree  or  equivalent  qualification  in  water  resources 
management, hydraulic engineering, or other related fields, and at least 15 years of experience 
in formulating international funded lending projects, including as team leader for at least one 
ADB PPTA. The specialist will have overall responsibility for effective and timely implementation

4  Appendix 4 
of the PPTA and quality of all PPTA outputs, and coordinating and consolidating inputs of 
government agencies and other specialists. 
 
7.  Environment and wetland ecology specialist (international, 2.5 pm). The specialist 
will have a master’s degree or equivalent qualification in environmental studies and at least 8 
years of experience in environmental assessment and ecological sciences. The specialist will (i) 
assess possible environmental impacts of each project activity; (ii) prepare an environmental 
impact  assessment  (EIA)  which  complies  with  ADB’s  Safeguard  Policy  Statement  (2009) 
requirements. 
 
8.  Social development and resettlement specialist (international, 1.5 pm). The specialist 
will  have  a  bachelor’s  degree  or  equivalent  qualification  in  social  safeguards  and/or 
development  studies  and  at  least  8  years  of  experience  in  resettlement  and/or  social 
development  studies.  The  specialist  will  be  responsible  for  the  preparation  of  all  social 
dimensions  and  safeguard  documents  and  ensure  that  (i)  no  one  will  suffer  unduly  from 
reallocations of water and tariff changes, and (ii) the necessary due-diligence on land use and 
rehabilitation issues is conducted. 
 
9.  Economist (international, 1.5 pm). The specialist will have a degree in economics, and 
at least 8 years of work experience in economic analyses of ADB- or World Bank-financed 
projects  related  to  environment  and  natural  resources  management.  The  specialist  will  (i) 
prepare the economic analysis of the project in line with ADB guidelines, and (ii) provide support 
for the national financial specialist. 
 
10.  Groundwater resources management specialist and deputy team leader (national, 6 
pm).  The  specialist  and  deputy  team  leader  will  have  a  bachelor’s  degree  or  equivalent 
qualification in groundwater resources management or other related fields and at least 10 years 
of  work  experience  in  formulating  foreign  funded  projects.  The  specialist  will  support  the 
international team leader to ensure the effective and timely implementation of the PPTA and be 
responsible for the coordination and reviewing of the design and quality control for output 1, 
which focuses on groundwater management. 
 
11.  Hydraulic  and  dam  safety  engineer  (national,  2  pm).  The  specialist  will  have  a 
university degree in hydraulic engineering and over 5 years of experience in designing hydraulic 
engineering projects. The specialist will specifically be responsible for the coordination and 
reviewing of the design and quality control for output 2, which focuses on hydraulic engineering. 
 
12.  Water  information  management  specialist  (national,  2  pm).  The  specialist  will 
preferably have a degree in water resources management, computer application, or relevant 
fields,  and  at  least  5  years  of  experience  in  developing  water  information  and  monitoring 
systems. The specialist will be responsible for the preparation of component 2(iii). 
 
13.  Hydrological and water allocation specialist (national, 3.5 pm). The specialist will 
preferably have a degree in hydrology, water resources management, or relevant field, and at 
least  5  years  of  experience  in  hydrological  studies  and  surface  water  management.  The 
specialist will (i) review the relevant government policy and plans regarding water resources 
management in the Shandong Province, (ii) assess and compile hydrological data to assess the 
feasibility  for  the  project,  (iii)  review  climate  change  aspects  and  conduct  climate  change 
proofing, and (iv) propose other cost-effective measures for improving water management in the 
Weifang-Zibo area.

14.  Wetland  ecology  specialist (national, 2.5 pm). The specialist will have a master’s 
degree or equivalent qualifications in wetland ecology, management, or rehabilitation, and at 
least 5 years of experience in design and management of wetlands. The specialist will be 
responsible for the assessment and design of wetland rehabilitation measures for project sites. 
 
15.  Environment specialist (national, 3 pm). The specialist will have a bachelor’s degree or 
equivalent  qualification  in  environmental  studies  and  at  least  5  years  of  experience  in 
conducting  environmental  assessment.  The  specialist  will  support  the  international 
environmental and wetland ecology specialist to (i) assess possible environmental impacts, and 
(ii) prepare an EIA which complies with ADB requirements. 
 
16.  Social development specialist (national, 3.5 pm). The specialist will have a bachelor’s 
degree or relevant qualification in social sciences and/or development studies and at least 5 
years  of  work  experience  in  social  development  studies.  The  specialist  will  support  the 
international social development and resettlement specialist to (i) conduct a poverty and social 
analysis; and (ii) prepare all social dimensions and safeguard documents, including SAP and 
gender action plan. 
 
17.  Resettlement specialist (national, 2 pm). The specialist will have a bachelor’s degree 
or  equivalent  qualification  in  social  safeguards  and  at  least  5  years  of  experience  in 
resettlement. The specialist will support the international social development and resettlement 
specialist to (i) collect data on land use in project impact areas and assess whether the project 
will cause any resettlement impacts; and (ii) assist the SWRD and project implementation 
offices in preparing resettlement plans, as required. 
 
18.  Financial specialist (national, 3 pm). The specialist will have a degree in accounting, 
finance,  or  financial  management  and  at  least  5  years  of  experience  in  project  financial 
management assessment. The specialist will (i) prepare project costs in cooperation with team 
leader  and  deputy  team  leader,  (ii)  conduct  a  financial  management  assessment  of  the 
executing and implementing agencies, and (iii) conduct financial sustainability analysis required 
the projects. 
 
19.  Economist (national, 2 pm). The specialist will have a degree in economics, or applied 
economics and at least 5 years of experience in economic analyses of ADB- or World Bank-
financed projects related to environment and natural resources management. The specialist will 
help the international economist conduct economic analysis of the project in line with ADB 
guidelines. 
 
20.  Project management and procurement specialist (national, 2 pm). The specialist will 
have a degree in engineering and at least 5 years of experience in project management, 
procurement,  and  consulting  services.  The  specialist  will  (i)  conduct  procurement  capacity 
assessment  for  the  executing  and  implementing  agencies  to  undertake  procurement  and 
consultant recruitments envisaged under the project, and (ii) prepare a procurement plan. 
 
B.  Multi-Donor Trust Fund under the WFPF 
 
21.  For the Multi-Donor Trust Funder under the WFPF financed consulting services, 5 pm of 
international and 5 pm of national consulting services will be provided. Specialists will be 
engaged by ADB following ADB’s Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (2013, as amended 
from time to time) using the individual consultant selection method.

6  Appendix 4 
22.  Groundwater  resource  policy  expert  and  team  leader  (international, 3 pm). The 
expert will preferably have a degree in water resources management or relevant field, and at 
least  15-year  work  experience  in  water  management  policies.  The  expert  will  (i)  review 
groundwater regulatory and  economic  instruments  that  are  currently  being  considered  and 
implemented in Hebei, Henan, Shanxi, Shandong, Beijing, and Tianjin; (ii) document specific 
case studies (including simple cost-benefit analysis and institutional requirements) of successful 
examples and promising opportunities that can be applied in Shandong Province; (iii) design the 
component on economic and regulatory instruments for the project; and (iv) summarize the 
study findings and workshop discussions into a final report, a knowledge product, and a policy 
brief on groundwater resources management. During the assignment, the expert will conduct 
consultations with the Ministry of Water Resources and the National Development and Reform 
Commission. 
 
23.  Groundwater recharge specialist (international, 2 pm). The specialist will preferably 
have a degree in groundwater resources management or equivalent qualifications, and at least 
8 year work experience with artificial groundwater recharge. The specialist will (i) conduct a brief 
assessment of international experiences on successful groundwater recharge and ecological 
restoration approaches; (ii) summarize groundwater recharge approaches in the PRC, including 
ecologic restoration programs (wetland, and floodplains) that are meant to promote groundwater 
recharge; (iii) explore opportunities to use treated wastewater for recharge and to enlarge 
current groundwater recharge areas in the Zibo-Weifang area, and (iv) design the groundwater 
recharge component for the project. 
 
24.  Integrated water resources management specialist (national, 5 pm). The specialist 
will preferably have a degree in water resources management or equivalent qualifications, and 
at least 7 years of experience in water management in the PRC. The specialist will (i) support 
the  international  consultants  with  data  collection  and  document  review,  and  (ii)  conduct  a 
national forum on innovative groundwater management instruments in the PRC. 
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
25.  The SWRD will be the executing agency. A project management office (PMO), chaired 
by  the  vice  governor  and  managed  by  the  deputy  director  general  of  the  SWRD,  will  be 
established to provide oversight and ensure coordination across sectors and provide guidance 
to  the  project  preparation  and  implementation.  The  PMO  will  comprise  of  staff  and 
representatives from the Shandong Finance Department, Shandong Development and Reform 
Commission,  SWRD,  and  other  relevant  agencies.  Qingzhou,  Changle,  Shouguang,  and 
Hanting counties in Weifang City and Huantai county in Zibo City will be the implementing 
agencies. The project cities and counties will also establish comprehensive local PMOs to 
implement project activities under their jurisdiction. The PMO will also administer day-to-day 
PPTA activities and coordinate with ADB and the implementing agencies. The five project 
counties will also establish local project implementation offices to carry out project activities 
under their jurisdiction. Disbursements under the PPTA will be done in accordance with ADB’s 
Technical  Assistance  Disbursement  Handbook  (2010,  as  amended  from  time  to  time). 
Procurement for the TA will be included in accordance with ADB’s Procurement Guidelines 
(2013, as amended from time to time). 
 
26.  The PPTA will be implemented over 18 months tentatively from 1 October 2013 to 31 
March 2015.2 The proposed PPTA’s processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table 
4.4.
